column4: U.S. judge approves HP shareholder deal over Autonomy acquisition
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Hewlett-Packard Co won preliminary approval from a U.S. judge to settle shareholder litigation on Friday involving the information technology company's botched acquisition of Autonomy Plc.

column4: French prosecutor seeks trial in HSBC Swiss bank tax-dodging case
column5: PARIS The French financial prosecutor's office has requested that HSBC's Swiss private bank be put on trial in France to answer charges over a suspected tax-dodging scheme for wealthy customers  a judicial source said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 3-French prosecutor seeks trial in HSBC Swiss bank tax-dodging case
column5: * HSBC refused plea bargain and 1.4 bln euro fine - Le Monde   (Adds details)

column4: French prosecutor trial request is normal step  HSBC's Swiss private bank says
column5: PARIS HSBC's Swiss private bank said a request by a French prosecutor for trial was a normal step in the judicial procedure that did not prejudge the result of the case.

column4: UPDATE 1-Itaú says $1 billion data center to help earnings in 2016
column5: MOGI MIRIM  Brazil  March 13 Itaú Unibanco Holding SA  Brazil's largest bank by market value  said on Friday it expected a new $1 billion data center to help curb its expenses and process transactions more rapidly by June of 2016.

column4: Itaú data center's impact on earnings seen in mid-2016
column5: MOGI MIRIM  Brazil  March 13 Itaú Unibanco Holding SA's new data center will begin to affect expenses and earnings only by the middle of next year  when the new facility takes over all processing of financial transactions  a senior executive esaid on Friday.

column4: Brazil's Itaú opens $1.05 bln data center in efficiency push
column5: MOGI MIRIM  Brazil  March 13 Itaú Unibanco Holding SA inaugurated on Friday a data center that will boost its capacity to handle transactions 25-fold and control costs as Brazil's largest bank by market value bets on efficiency to protect profits.

column4: Sabadell bid for TSB could be blocked by UK regulator - analysts
column5: LONDON  March 13 Banco Sabadell's  plans to buy TSB could be scuppered by Britain's financial services regulator  analysts said on Friday.

column4: India Morning Call-Global Markets
column5: NEW YORK - U.S. stocks rose in a broad rally on Thursday  bouncing back from two days of losses  helped by weaker retail sales that paused the dollar's recent rally and tempered the outlook for interest rates.

column4: U.S. home improvement group says members should avoid Lumber Liquidators
column5: CHICAGO The National Association of the Remodeling Industry (NARI) said on Friday that its members should avoid working with Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc  or any other vendors that do not meet their sourcing requirements.

column4: Lumber Liquidators' defense not convincing enough: analysts
column5: Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc's  shares fell as much as 10 percent on Friday  reversing some gains from a day earlier  after brokerages cut their price targets  saying the hardwood flooring retailer's defense of its products left some questions unanswered.

column4: UPDATE 1-Lumber Liquidators' defense not convincing enough - analysts
column5: March 13 Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc's  shares fell as much as 10 percent on Friday  reversing some gains from a day earlier  after brokerages cut their price targets  saying the hardwood flooring retailer's defense of its products left some questions unanswered.

column4: Lumber Liquidators defense not convincing enough-analysts
column5: March 13 Shares of Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc's fell 8 percent on Friday  reversing some gains from a day earlier  after brokerages cut price targets  saying the hardwood flooring retailer's defense of its products left some questions unanswered.

column4: Strike at Marathon's Galveston Bay plant to continue: USW official
column5: HOUSTON A strike by the United Steelworkers (USW) local union at the   Marathon Petroleum Corp Galveston Bay Refinery in Texas City  Texas  will continue as long as the company refuses to accept the terms of a newly-negotiated national agreement without encumberances  said a union official on Friday.

column4: Apple pies and iPads sweeten China's dreaded TV expose
column5: SHANGHAI From cut-price apple pies to free iPads  companies in China are transforming Sunday's dreaded consumer rights day into a shopping frenzy  to blunt the impact of being named and shamed in state broadcaster CCTV's annual expose. | Video

column4: Merck expects to be denied approval for sugammadex injection again
column5: Merck & Co Inc said it expects its long-delayed drug to reverse the effects of anesthesia to be denied U.S. approval after U.S. regulators said they need to conduct more site inspections related to a study of the drug.

column4: UPDATE 1-Merck expects to be denied approval for sugammadex injection again
column5: March 13 Merck & Co Inc said it expects its long-delayed drug to reverse the effects of anesthesia to be denied U.S. approval after U.S. regulators said they need to conduct more site inspections related to a study of the drug.

column4: Merck expects to be denied approval for sugammadex injection again
column5: March 13 Merck & Co Inc said it expected to be denied U.S. approval for its sugammadex injection  after the U.S. Food and Drug Administration said it would conduct additional site inspections related to a study of the drug.

column4: Japan's Mizuho to merge 3 asset-management operations -sources
column5: TOKYO  March 13 Mizuho Financial Group Inc  plans to merge its three asset management operations  which between then control publicly offered trusts worth more than 6 trillion yen ($50 billion)  people with direct knowledge of the matter said.

column4: Fuji Media wins bid for Japan hotels over Orix  Morgan Stanley
column5: TOKYO A real estate arm of a Japanese media group Fuji Media Holdings edged out a fund run by Morgan Stanley  and others to buy a hotel holding company from a Japanese government-controlled fund  people involved in the sale said.

column4: Fuji Media wins bid for Japan hotels over Orix  Morgan Stanley
column5: TOKYO  March 13 A real estate arm of a Japanese media group Fuji Media Holdings edged out a fund run by Morgan Stanley and others to buy a hotel holding company from a Japanese government-controlled fund  people involved in the sale said.

column4: MSCI faces opposition to China inclusion in key index -sources
column5: HONG KONG  March 13 Leading global fund managers say China must make bolder market reforms before Chinese-listed shares can be included in key MSCI emerging market benchmark indexes.

column4: Nomura  RBS face U.S. mortgage trial; $1 billion damages at stake
column5: NEW YORK A U.S. housing regulator is set to take two of the world's biggest banks to trial on Monday to try and recoup more than $1 billion in damages over mortgage bonds sold to government-run mortgage finance companies ahead of the 2008 economic crisis.

column4: Venezuela confirms to file for annulment of $455 mln Owens-Illinois award
column5: CARACAS  March 13 Venezuela said on Friday it has started the process of filing for the annulment of an award that orders the South American country to pay U.S. bottle maker Owens-Illinois $455 million in compensation for nationalizations.

column4: Brazilian credits lead LatAm bond markets lower
column5: NEW YORK  March 13 (IFR) - A plunge in the Brazilian Real and in oil prices  combined with reports that state-run Petrobras is seeking to further delay the release of audited financial statements  provided an explosive mix for Brazilian credits on Friday.

column4: Petrobras refinery cracker fixed  coke unit to restart Friday
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Brazilian state-run oil company Petrobras has completed repairs to a broken catalytic-cracking unit that cut output at the Duque de Caxias Refinery by about a quarter for a month  a union representing workers at the plant told Reuters on Friday.

column4: Brazil takes center stage in weaker LatAm credit market
column5: NEW YORK  March 13 (IFR) - A relentless roster of bad news out of Brazil were hurting bond spreads on the country's credits Friday.

column4: Telecom Italia tower unit files for share listing
column5: MILAN  March 13 Telecom Italia said on Friday its tower unit Infrastrutture Wireless Italiane (Inwit) had filed with the Italian market regulator to list its shares on the Milan bourse.

column4: U.S. arms buyer sees no cost impact from possible Sikorsky spin
column5: WASHINGTON  March 12 A spinoff of United Technologies Corp's Sikorsky Aircraft as a standalone company should not have any impact on the U.S. Defense Department's costs  the Pentagon's acquisition chief said Thursday.

column4: Schwab says first-quarter profit running 1 cent behind year ago
column5: NEW YORK Charles Schwab Corp's first-quarter earnings per share are currently running about 1 cent lower than the 24 cents a share it reported in the first quarter of 2014.

column5: March 13 Financial advisory firms are so busy trying to prevent computer hacking that they sometimes neglect an equally vital issue: what to do when hackers succeed.

column4: OLYMPICS-IOC names Toyota Motor Corp as new Games sponsor
column5: March 13 Japan's Toyota Motor Corporation  has joined the group of leading sponsors of the Olympic Games in an agreement that runs until 2024  the International Olympic Committee (IOC) said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. regulator says Trinity guardrail meets standards
column5: WASHINGTON  March 13 A U.S. regulator said on Friday that testing on the guardrail most commonly used on U.S. Interstate Highways indicates the product is safe  sparing governments the huge cost of having to replace hundreds of thousands of guardrail caps used nationwide.

column4: United Tech CEO: Sale of Sikorsky would be hard due to taxes
column5: NEW YORK United Technologies Corp's  chief executive officer said on Thursday that a sale of its Sikorsky helicopter unit would be "very hard" due to the heavy tax liability that would come with such a disposition.

column5: March 13 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Friday:

column4: REFILE-Valeant deal survives Endo surprise
column5: NEW YORK  March 13 (IFR) - Pharmaceuticals firm Endo stunned the market with a last-minute bid for Salix last Wednesday  but the surprise turn of events did little to dent demand for a multi-billion dollar junk bond issue backing rival Valeant's bid.

column4: Valeant plans to raise offer for Salix: source
column5: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  plans to raise its bid for Salix Pharmaceuticals Ltd  to above $160 per share  a source familiar with matter told Reuters  hoping to end a bidding war with Endo International Plc.

column4: Valeant plans to raise offer for Salix - source
column5: March 13 Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc plans to raise its bid for Salix Pharmaceuticals Ltd to above $160 per share  a source familiar with matter told Reuters  hoping to end a bidding war with Endo International Plc.

column5: WASHINGTON The Justice Department said on Friday it granted antitrust approval for Waste Management Inc's  purchase of Deffenbaugh Disposal  Inc.

column4: Fitch Affirms and Withdraws Webster Financial's 'BBB' IDR
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  March 13 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed and withdrawn the 'BBB/F2'  long- and short-term IDRs for Webster Financial Corporation (WBS) and its  principal banking subsidiary Webster Bank  NA. The ratings are being withdrawn  for commercial reasons. A full list of rating actions follows at the end of this  release. KEY RATINGS DRIVERS - IDRs  VRs  AND SENIOR DEBT WBS' rating affirmation reflects its solid Connecticut franchise
